text:
When it comes to keeping track of diabetes, the manual process can be a bit of a pain. But today's advancements in technology has taken away this headache for diabetic people.
Now diabetic patient scan easily monitor blood sugar levels with portable devices such as blood glucose meters and Continuous Glucose Monitoring System (CGMS) or apps which sync data from your glucometer and automatically calculate glucose trends, track dosage, and generate easy-to-share reports with healthcare professionals and family members.
Here are 5 Top Apps to Manage Diabetes:
1. mySugr: A highly user-friendly and customizable diabetes logbook that allows patients to keep track of food, medicine, exercise, and blood glucose levels all on their smartphone. [Free iOS | Android ]
2. One Drop - Powered by Informed Data Systems: A premium digital health platform for diabetes management that combines data analytics, artificial intelligence, and personalized guidance. Integrates with leading CGMs including Dexcom, FreeStyle Libre, and more. [Monthly fee - starting at $34.99. Free trial | iTunes | Google Play]
3. Glucosio: Simplify diabetes tracking with personalized insights from over a million registered data points. Features tailored nutrition guidance and automated dosing calculations for injectable diabetes medications like insulin and victoza. [Premium subscription | Free Lite Version | iTunes| Google Play]
